blog.name: foxy-voxy
blog.title: You Expect A Theme Now?
blog.description: AKA voxangelus, foxy-voxy, peppermint. Old enough to know better but way too irreverent to care. I have a 13 year old, so I'm technically old enough to be your mom. Many people's honourary auntie or fandom mom. Ficcer. Library worker. Calligrapher/letterer. Tarot Reader. Cis female. She/Her/Hers. Pansexual. Largely Homoromantic. Polyam. Slytherin.

blog.name: judelaw
blog.title: I hope Jude Law is having a great day.
blog.description: Jude Law said ‘Nice to meet you’ while shaking my hand and that’s all the affection I need in life. [❄] | Instagram | [♡] | Twitter

tags: my nerd boy who makes me watch his nerd things whether i want to or not
title: All SyfyWire
excerpt: Watch full episodes, get news, see trailers, videos and interviews for everything from the worlds of sci-fi, fantasy, horror and comics
description:
“Their bond as mentor and mentee, pupil and sensei, and how they met and what they offer to each other is very much at the heart of the film and the journey that Brie’s character goes on,” he explained.

There has been plenty of speculation on just who Law’s character is in the film other than the leader of Starforce, “an elite special forces-esque group of Kree warriors” which Captain Marvel is a part of.

“I’d say that as leader of the group I lead by example, so he’s very much hands-on combat,” said Law. “The relationship really is about containment. There’s a sort of control to my character, a sense of focus and clarity and discipline, and really that’s one of the things of the piece is trying to contain: what is being in control and what isn’t.”

[…]

“I think that a lesson I learned over the last few years is that when you take on characters with enormous sort of backgrounds or worldviews or situations that seem to be beyond one’s personal imagination, it’s always possible to play an individual and an individual within that,” said Law. “Whether they’re in awe of it or just dealing with it daily, you just sort of root it in simple things: we just talked about one; what’s the motivation? What’s your relationship with those around you daily?”

While jumping into a huge world like the MCU could be intimidating (and provide tons of homework) Law said he was fairly aware of the universe already.

“Well the test of it is the Infinity War, right?” he said. “Like if anyone goes and sees Infinity War and says ‘Who’s that? What’s that all about?’ then you haven’t seen them all and I didn’t ask that question once. So clearly I’ve seen all of them. I actually had a couple of people next to me saying 'Who’s she? What is she doing?’ So I was pretty conversant, but with my character, in particular, there was a question 'Should I go back and read up?’ This is a very interesting chapter I think in the Marvel Universe, because it’s split off in several ways, and I know a lot of them have come out in different guises, but this one even more so. I chose really just to follow the script.”

blog.name: welcome-to-latveria
blog.title: For Latverians, that is the face of hope.
blog.description: Comics ruined my life but I'm too deep in now to turn back

tags: im sorry i just really hate the illuminati
summary: Secret Wars (2015) is honestly so wild like Dr Doom is God of this whole world that he fucking salvaged out of a bunch of...
body:
Secret Wars (2015) is honestly so wild like Dr Doom is God of this whole world that he fucking salvaged out of a bunch of different universes and then just smashed them together into one place cos like why not in order to save as much of the multiverse as he could and then one day the remnants of the Illuminati rock up in their ship they used to escape from 616 cos they’re cowards and literally just decided their lives were worth more than the rest of the people in their world and escaped leaving everyone else to die and so they get to this world and have the fucking nerve to straight away just decide to tear it apart because they think they can do better or whatever idek.

Like??? You had the chance to do better alrdy? Everything about this situation is your fault? The reason Doom had to do any of that at all is because you failed to come up with a solution to all the universes just smashing into each other and when Doom found out that was happening you didn’t bother answering his questions about wtf was going on ultimately leaving him to his own devices which you should have realised was a dumb fucking idea. There is literally not one aspect of this whole event that you didn’t orchestrate by being a dumb bitch

tl;dr: the Illuminati are cowards who left their own world to die so can they stop throwing a hissy fit

tl;dr: the Illuminati are cowards who left their own world to die so can they stop throwing a hissy fit
trail.content:
Secret Wars (2015) is honestly so wild like Dr Doom is God of this whole world that he fucking salvaged out of a bunch of different universes and then just smashed them together into one place cos like why not in order to save as much of the multiverse as he could and then one day the remnants of the Illuminati rock up in their ship they used to escape from 616 cos they’re cowards and literally just decided their lives were worth more than the rest of the people in their world and escaped leaving everyone else to die and so they get to this world and have the fucking nerve to straight away just decide to tear it apart because they think they can do better or whatever idek.

Like??? You had the chance to do better alrdy? Everything about this situation is your fault? The reason Doom had to do any of that at all is because you failed to come up with a solution to all the universes just smashing into each other and when Doom found out that was happening you didn’t bother answering his questions about wtf was going on ultimately leaving him to his own devices which you should have realised was a dumb fucking idea. There is literally not one aspect of this whole event that you didn’t orchestrate by being a dumb bitch

tl;dr: the Illuminati are cowards who left their own world to die so can they stop throwing a hissy fit
